Pseudomonas aeruginosa is a common pathogen in patients with cystic fibrosis and can cause pneumonia. The purulent, yellow sputum and the right lower lobe pneumonia also suggest this organism. Haemophilus influenzae and Streptococcus pneumoniae are common causes of pneumonia but are not typically associated with cystic fibrosis. Staphylococcus aureus can cause pneumonia but is less likely in this patient population.
